attributes.action: educate motorists that they stopped paying road tax in the 1940s.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Contrary to popular belief, motorists don't pay any more towards the upkeep and maintenance of the roads than any other adult taxpayer.

Roads are maintained from general spend - from council tax and from general taxation - not from 'road tax', which was abolished in the post-War years amidst fears that motorists would feel they owned the roads.
